meanings.def: behaving in a sensible way, like an adult
examples: Jane is very mature for her age.
a mature and sensible attitude
She tries to look mature and sophisticated.
sexually mature
a mature oak/eagle/elephant
She’s getting old—she’s 75 next year.
She is very busy caring for two elderly relatives.
Having aged relatives to stay in your house can be quite stressful.
Everyone in my family is exceptionally long-lived.
clothes for the mature woman

meanings.def: developed over a period of time to produce a strong, rich taste
used as a polite or humorous way of saying that somebody is no longer young
examples: clothes for the mature woman
a man of mature years

meanings.def: created late in an artist’s life and showing great understanding and skill
after thinking about something carefully and for a long time

idioms.def: after thinking about something carefully and for a long time

meanings.def: to become fully grown or developed
examples: This particular breed of cattle matures early.
Technology in this field has matured considerably over the last decade.
The little garden was maturing nicely.
The teenage years cover a period in which people mature physically and emotionally.

meanings.def: to develop emotionally and start to behave like a sensible adult
examples: He has matured a great deal over the past year.

meanings.def: to fully develop a particular skill or quality
examples: She has matured into one of the country's finest actresses.

meanings.def: if wine, cheese, etc. matures or is matured, it develops over a period of time to produce a strong, rich taste
examples: The cheese is smoked and then left to mature.
a fully matured cheese

meanings.def: to reach the date when it must be paid
examples: She has a number of investments that mature at the end of the year.
